title: Quiz 3: Ethical Issues
description: Ethics, consent, and rights of research participants.

questions.question: Which ethical principle states 'one should do good and do no harm'?
questions.explanation: Beneficence means doing good and avoiding harm.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered vulnerable groups requiring special protection? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Children, mentally impaired persons, and prisoners are vulnerable groups.
questions.hint: Consider who may not be able to give fully informed consent.

questions.question: Anonymity means the researcher knows the participant's identity but promises not to reveal it.
questions.explanation: That is Confidentiality. Anonymity means the researcher cannot link data to the individual.
questions.hint: Anonymity means no one knows who provided the data.

questions.question: When a researcher fails to adequately inform participants about the nature of the research to influence their decision, it is called ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Deception occurs when researchers withhold information to influence participation.

questions.question: Match the ethical right with its description.

pairs.right: Freedom to determine when/how private info is shared
Identity is not revealed/linked to data
Autonomy to accept or decline participation

questions.explanation: Privacy controls sharing, Anonymity protects identity, Fair Treatment ensures justice, Self-determination allows autonomy.
questions.hint: Think about what each right protects.

questions.question: What is the primary function of an Informed Consent form?

options.text: To protect the researcher from lawsuits
To ensure participants understand the study and agree voluntarily
To gather data about the participant

questions.explanation: Informed consent ensures participants understand and voluntarily agree to participate.
questions.hint: Focus on the participant's understanding and choice.

questions.question: Which of the following constitute research misconduct? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Plagiarism, fraud, and misuse of privileges are misconduct. Reporting negative findings is ethical.

questions.question: It is ethical to withhold beneficial treatment from a control group if it is known to be effective.
questions.explanation: Withholding known beneficial treatment is unethical.

questions.question: Which body in Kenya deals with approval and authorization of research?
acceptedAnswers: National Council for Science and Technology
questions.hint: Think about the Kenyan science and technology regulatory body.

questions.question: The principle of Justice includes the right to:
questions.explanation: Justice includes fair treatment, selection, and privacy rights.
questions.hint: Justice is about fairness in selection and treatment.
